title: SQS
description: Process messages from an SQS queue using AWS Lambda
implementation: Process messages from an AWS SQS queue using Lambda functions. The Lambda function is triggered automatically when messages arrive in the queue, processes them, and can forward the results to other AWS services.

title: AMQP
description: Process messages from AMQP message queues
implementation: Listen to messages on AMQP message queues like RabbitMQ and trigger serverless workloads to process them. Supports content-type, routing keys, and other AMQP features.

title: SNS
description: Process notifications from AWS SNS topics
implementation: Subscribe to AWS SNS topics to receive and process notifications. Supports filtering messages and triggering multiple downstream processors.

title: Azure Queue Storage
description: Process messages from Azure Storage Queues
implementation: Consume and process messages from Azure Storage queues. Supports message batching and visibility timeout.

title: Azure Service Bus
description: Process messages from Azure Service Bus queues and topics
implementation: Listen to Azure Service Bus queues and topics to process messages. Supports sessions, dead-lettering, and other enterprise messaging features.

title: Bitbucket
implementation: Handle Bitbucket Cloud webhook events for repository activities. Supports repository filtering and webhook secret validation.

title: Bitbucket Server
implementation: Handle Bitbucket Server webhook events for self-hosted instances. Supports API token authentication and project/repository filtering.

title: Calendar
description: Trigger workloads on schedule or intervals
implementation: Schedule workloads using cron expressions or fixed intervals. Supports timezone-aware scheduling and custom payloads.

title: Emitter
implementation: Subscribe to Emitter.io channels to process real-time messages. Supports secure key-based authentication and channel filtering.

title: File System
implementation: Watch for file system events like create, modify, and delete. Supports directory monitoring and file pattern matching.

title: GCP Pub/Sub
description: Process messages from Google Cloud Pub/Sub
implementation: Subscribe to GCP Pub/Sub topics to receive and process messages. Supports message attributes and ordering keys.

title: GitHub
implementation: Handle GitHub webhook events like push, pull request, and issue comments. Supports repository filtering and secret validation.

title: GitLab Webhook
implementation: Handle GitLab webhook events for repository activities. Supports project filtering and token-based authentication.

title: Kafka Event Processing
description: Process messages from Apache Kafka topics
implementation: Consume messages from Kafka topics and process them. Supports consumer groups and message partitioning.

title: MinIO
implementation: Handle MinIO bucket notifications for object operations. Supports bucket filtering and event type selection.

title: MQTT Event Processing
implementation: Subscribe to MQTT topics and process messages. Supports QoS levels and topic filtering.

title: NATS Event Processing
description: Process messages from NATS messaging system
implementation: Subscribe to NATS subjects and process messages. Supports wildcards and queue groups.

title: NSQ Event Processing
description: Process messages from NSQ messaging platform
implementation: Consume messages from NSQ topics and channels. Supports distributed message processing and fault tolerance.

title: Apache Pulsar
implementation: Subscribe to Pulsar topics and process messages. Supports multi-tenancy and geo-replication.

title: Redis Streams
implementation: Consume messages from Redis Streams using consumer groups. Supports message acknowledgment and last-position recovery.

title: Redis
implementation: Subscribe to Redis channels to receive and process messages. Supports pattern-based subscriptions.

title: Resource Watch
implementation: Watch Kubernetes resources for changes and trigger workloads. Supports label/field selectors and event filtering.

title: SFTP
implementation: Poll SFTP servers for file changes and trigger workloads. Supports authentication and file pattern matching.

title: Webhook
implementation: Handle incoming HTTP webhook requests and trigger workloads. Supports request validation and custom endpoints.
